Class com.icl.saxon.ElementSorter 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----com.icl.saxon.ElementHandlerBase
           |
           +----com.icl.saxon.ElementSorter
public class ElementSorter
extends ElementHandlerBase
Class ElementSorter

Establish sorting on the elements within a group.

A group is defined as a number of consecutive elements of the same type, subordinate to the same parent element.

Restriction:Do not use this for an element that can be nested within itself. The effect of doing so is undefined.

ElementSorter outputs nothing for the start and end of each element, but outputs the character content of each element. To change this behaviour, write a subclass of ElementSorter. The subclass must invoke the beforeGroup, startElement, endElement, and afterGroup methods of this class to achieve the correct sorting behaviour.

ElementSorter(String, String, String, String)
Constructor supplies parameters to control sorting.

afterGroup(ElementInfo)
At the end of a group of elements, scan the temporary output streams and write them to the original output stream in sort key order
beforeGroup(ElementInfo)
Before a group of elements, output the registered "before" string
characters(ElementInfo, char[], int, int)
Character content is copied to the output stream.
endElement(ElementInfo)
At the end of an element, read the value of the sort key, and save the output of this element for later
startElement(ElementInfo)
At the start of an element, allocate an internal writer to hold the output for this element until later.

ElementSorter 
 public ElementSorter(String sortkey,
                      String before,
                      String between,
                      String after)
Constructor supplies parameters to control sorting.

Parameters:
sortkey - The attribute on which the elements will be sorted. This may be an actual XML attribute in the input document, or a pseudo-attribute created using setExtendedAttribute(). It may also be the special value "*" which refers to the character content of the element. The attribute is examined at the end of each element, so it is possible to set up attributes while the element is processed, for example, while processing a child element.
before - A string to be output before the first element in a sorted group of elements
between - A string to be output after each element in the sorted output, other than the last
after - A string to be output after the last element in the sorted group of elements

beforeGroup 
 public void beforeGroup(ElementInfo e) throws SAXException
Before a group of elements, output the registered "before" string

Overrides:
beforeGroup in class ElementHandlerBase
startElement 
 public void startElement(ElementInfo e) throws SAXException
At the start of an element, allocate an internal writer to hold the output for this element until later. The application must not itself attempt to allocate a writer for this element.

Overrides:
startElement in class ElementHandlerBase
characters 
 public void characters(ElementInfo e,
                        char ch[],
                        int start,
                        int length) throws SAXException
Character content is copied to the output stream. This behaviour can be overridden in a subclass
